lowlands.p1: Based on your Youtube viewing history we can get a rough sketch of your interests and musical tastes. We will keep track of the shared tastes of all participants on the big screen in the Digital Footprints Lab tent!
lowlands.p2: Which of the following musical genres do you like best?
lowlands.p3: You can also get a (temporary) tattoo of these illustrations!

annotate.nodata: No {{data}} data was imported, so you cannot answer this question.
annotate.dropdown: Search for a channel or the name of a video from this channel
annotate.pleaseanswer: Please answer all questions to continue
annotate.question: Does this channel cover content about news and current affairs?

confirm.server: Your data will be send to
confirm.cleanup: You can immediately delete your data. Note that this only deletes the data from this application. If you stored data on your computer, you might also want to delete it there.

donated.failure: Failed to submit {{filename}} data. Please try again, and contact the researchers or survey company if the problem persists

confirm.header: Please confirm that you understand and agree with the following conditions
confirm.testuser: You are logged in as a test user, so your real data won't be submitted. The server will only see what types of data you submitted, and how many items

remove.list1: Type one search term per row
remove.list3: Terms needs to be at least 3 characters long

validate.header1: In the wordcloud you see the top items from your {{dataname}} data.
validate.header2: The following questions help us understand how accurate this data is.

delete.confirm: Are you sure you want to delete {{n}} {{items}}?

dropzone.p1: Use this blue field to load the downloaded data into this application
dropzone.p2: If the data is a folder, you need to drag it into this field. If it's a file (or zipped folder), you can also click on this field.

chrome.l1: Click on the three dots in the upper right corner

firefox.l3: Click on the folder icon (on the right in the popup) to 'Show in folder'

where.general: By default, most browsers save your downloaded files in the Download folder on your computer. If you have trouble finding the folder, you can also open it from your browser

safari.l1: Click on the downloads Icon in the upper right corner
safari.l2: Click on the magnifying glass Icon next to a file to open the folder

deleteButton.content1: Do you want to delete all the gathered data from the browser?
deleteButton.content2: Note that any data you downloaded will still be on your computer, so you might want to delete that as well

donate.description: Support academic research by sharing your data

donateCard.name: Donate

status.any: Some of the data types are not yet (successfull) gathered. You can continue, but some data will be missing

donateCard.subname: Click here to go to the donation screen

removeCard.name: Exclude data
removeCard.subname: Use keywords to search and remove any data that you prefer not to share

donate.title: Step 3. Donate

explore.description: This step is optional, but aren't you curious?
explore.title: Step 2. Explore

gather.description: Click a card to gather your data

gatherCard.click: Click here to gather the following data:

gather.title: Step 1. Gather

navi.header: Hi there! This application works in three steps:
navi.step1: The first step is to gather data by clicking on one of the cards in the Gather column and following the instruction. At this point you haven't yet donated your data, but only loaded the data into your own browser
navi.step2: In the second step you can Explore your own data. If you find data that you don't want to share, you can also delete it here.
navi.step3: In the final step you can Donate your data for academic research. The data will only be donated after you complete all steps and given your consent. Note that you can also use the Exclude data card to exclude some data from the donation, if you haven't done this already in the Explore step.

routing.leavemessage: Are you sure you want to leave? All data will be lost.

welcome.header: Welcome to the Digital Footprints Lab!

notpersistent.header: If possible, use a different browser
notpersistent.p: This application works best in recent versions of Chrome, Safari, Edge, Firefox and Opera. For some browsers, like Firefox, it works better when not in private mode. You can still use the application with your current browser, but your data won't be stored if you leave. Don't worry though! you'll get a warning when you try to refresh or leave the page so this doesn't easily happen by accident.

welcome.p1: This application let's you collect and explore your own digital traces. All the data is stored and processed on your own device, so it doesn't touch the internet.
welcome.p2: You can also donate a selection of this data for scientific research. This data will only be used for non-commercial research by a select group of academics, for research that is approved by the ethical board of their university.
welcome.subheader1: Gather and explore your digital footprints
welcome.subheader2: Donate data to support academic research

noid.header: Provide a user ID or login as test user
noid.p1: The link that brought you to this website did not contain a user ID. If you are participating in a study, this should not be possible, and you should contact the researchers or survey company.
noid.p2: You can either provide a (unique) user ID yourself, or login as a test user. As a test user your real data will not be send to a server. If you complete the data donation steps, the server will receive a dummy submission with fake data.
